events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on April 28th causing significant damage to the vehicle's front bumper and hood.
The claim was reviewed and correctly categorised as an Auto Accident claim based on the description of the vehicle collision.
An agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim for further communication and processing.
The company acknowledged receipt of the vehicle collision claim and informed the customer about the next steps in the process.
The agent requested copies of the accident police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and the insurance policy details from the claimant.
The customer submitted all required documents including the police report and vehicle damage photos to support the claim investigation.
The claim investigation commenced with a review of submitted evidence and contacting the repair shop for an initial damage assessment.
The investigation into the auto accident was completed confirming the extent of damages and validating the claim details provided by the customer.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant for vehicle repair costs, including parts and labor, based on the investigation results.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement, expressing satisfaction with the responsiveness and thoroughness of the claim process.
The claim was formally approved by the claims department following customer acceptance of the settlement offer.
Payment for the approved vehicle repairs was issued to the customerâ€™s preferred bank account to cover the agreed settlement amount.
The auto accident claim file was officially closed after confirmation that the payment was received and repairs completed satisfactorily.
The claim documentation and related correspondence were archived for future reference and compliance with regulatory record-keeping requirements.
